1.title: Just One of the Boyz 4 Now for Now
1.plot: Convinced she's met the love of her life, Tina decides to disguise herself as a boy and sneak into the Boyz 4 Now auditions to find him. Back at the restaurant, Teddy asks the rest of the Belcher gang to nurse his baby rat back to health.

2.title: The Taking of Funtime One Two Three
2.plot: With help from Mr. Fischoeder, the Belcher kids devise a master plan to win the grand prize dune buggy at their local arcade; Teddy promises Bob and Linda fresh eggs if they take in a chicken.

3.title: Tweentrepreneurs
3.plot: Tina, Louise, and Gene get a taste of business when they join the school's Tweentrepeneurs club. Back at the restaurant, Bob and Linda find themselves outsmarted by a dine-and-dasher.

4.title: Nightmare on Ocean Avenue Street
4.plot: The Belcher kids set out to find the culprit who's snatching everyone's candy bags on Halloween night. Meanwhile, Teddy gets carried away when he decorates the restaurant to compete with another handyman on the street.

5.title: Live and Let Fly
5.plot: The Belcher kids' revenge plan against the school counselor gets them involved in a sibling rivalry between two pilots. Meanwhile Teddy invites Bob and Linda to a paper airplane contest.

6.title: Bobby Driver
6.plot: Bob drives a professional quilter around town when she talks him into joining her revenge plot; the kids attend a Gatsby-themed birthday party; Linda helps Teddy expand his taste palate.

7.title: I Bob Your Pardon
7.plot: The Belchers try to save a turkey from the slaughterhouse.

8.title: Roller? I Hardly Know Her!
8.plot: Gene is upset with his best friend ditching him for Courtney as a roller-dancing partner; Teddy, Linda and Bob discover someone stalking the restaurant.

9.title: UFO No You Didn't
9.plot: Tina and her new science partner create a device that allows them to communicate with aliens, but their excitement turns to fear when they receive a dangerous warning message. Meanwhile, Bob attempts to sell mini coat racks he bought.

10.title: Better Off Sled
10.plot: The Belcher kids get into a turf war with teenagers who take their usual sledding territory; Bob tries to help Linda knit three scarves before Christmas.

11.title: Lorenzo's Oil? No, Linda's
11.plot: Linda's new friend introduces her to essential oils and Aunt Gayle is convinced she must be rescued. Meanwhile, Bob and Teddy are bamboozled into performing a series of annoying favors for Mr. Huggins.

12.title: The Helen Hunt
12.plot: The Belchers help Teddy find his dream girl, but Tina believes she's found a better match for him.

13.title: Bed, Bob and Beyond
13.plot: A Valentine's Day fight between Bob and Linda has the kids feeling confused. After a failed attempt to see a movie, it's up to Tina, Louise and Gene to tell their own story as a distraction from the awkward tension.

14.title: Every Which Way but Goose
14.plot: Tina, discouraged by not being asked to prom by Jimmy Jr., forms an unhealthy attachment to a goose from the nearby park. Meanwhile, Linda joins a dating app to help Gretchen find a match.

15.title: The Fresh Princ-ipal
15.plot: Things get out of hand when Louise wins a contest to be Principal for a Day. Meanwhile, Teddy attempts to help Bob when he suddenly finds himself unable to flip burgers.

16.title: Roamin' Bob-iday
16.plot: Bob winds up working at a local sandwich shop when the family forces him to take a day off; a last-minute baby shower is thrown for a female biker group.

17.title: Episode #9.17
17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: Episode #9.18
18.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

19.title: Episode #9.19
19.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

0.title: Pilot
0.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Human Flesh
1.plot: On top of watching his dysfunctional family crumble around him, Bob faces the wrath of a jealous health inspector who cooks up a nasty rumor about the restaurant's choice of meat.

2.title: Crawl Space
2.plot: His in-law's are coming into town, and Bob tries desperately to concoct a plan to avoid them for as long as he can. Unfortunately, Bob did not plan to get stuck in the recesses of the family restaurant.

3.title: Sacred Cow
3.plot: A filmmaker placed a cow outside the restaurant to make a statement, which angers Bob, but his family is confused over how he treats the cow.

4.title: Sexy Dance Fighting
4.plot: Tina is going through the heartbreak of puberty; once they see it is not contagious, Gene and Louise try to cheer up their big sister. They show her what they believe is a smelly special needs breakdancing class in Brazilian. Tina's hormones are fueled by lithe, muscular Jairo and his martial art, Capoeira. Soon, it is "Jairo says this" and "Jairo says that" and Tina is neglecting her job, working night and day, to master Capoeira. Tina wants to earn her yellow corda in the Troca de Cordões ceremony, Portuguese for "exchange of strands." Teddy equates it with becoming...

5.title: Hamburger Dinner Theater
5.plot: Linda is dying to relive her dream of becoming a star on Broadway, so she decides to host a dinner theater at the restaurant. But on opening night a shocking surprise leaves Linda with a more chilling production than she planned for.

6.title: Sheesh! Cab, Bob?
6.plot: Bob takes a second job as a nighttime cab driver so he can give Tina the 13th birthday party she deserves, and he makes some surprising new friends along the ride.

7.title: Bed & Breakfast
7.plot: Linda gets really excited about opening a Bed and Breakfast to capitalize on the high volume of tourists coming into town, but when the guests start to arrive Louise senses espionage afoot.

8.title: Art Crawl
8.plot: Linda's eccentric sister Gayle comes to town intending to use the restaurant as a gallery for her paintings during this year's "Art Crawl." Bob is left totally oblivious the comically explicit nature of Gayle's artwork until it's too late.

9.title: Spaghetti Western and Meatballs
9.plot: Bob and Gene bond over spaghetti western movies, which makes Louise jealous.

10.title: Burger War
10.plot: Bob's landlord has been understanding about the consistent delay in rent, but payment time has come. After getting wind of Bob's financial trouble, Jimmy Pesto faces-off against his mortal enemy by introducing burgers to his own menu.

11.title: Weekend at Mort's
11.plot: The family has to stay next door at Mort the Mortician's house since the restaurant is infested with mold. Bob and Linda double date with Mort and his mysterious Internet-girlfriend; while Tina entertains her siblings in the crematorium.

12.title: Lobsterfest
12.plot: Bob is likely the only person in town excited about the cancellation of this years "Lobsterfest" due to inclement weather. Bob strikes gold when he opens the restaurant regardless of the storm, and is celebrated by the masses.

13.title: Torpedo
13.plot: Bob is giddy as ever when his role model, minor league pitcher Torpedo Jones, gives a shout-out to the restaurant during a game, but is blind-sided upon finding out Torpedo endorses his burgers for reasons which are morally shaky at best.

1.title: The Belchies
1.plot: The kids hunt for treasure in an abandoned taffy factory and Bob and Linda must find them before the factory's scheduled demolition.

2.title: Bob Day Afternoon
2.plot: Bob storms away from First Oceanside Savings Bank, his plea for loan restructure ignored; some guy is holding up the bank and taking hostages. Louise is assigned an essay for school on the most important person in her life. Since Bob's Burgers is across the street from the bank, the FBI and other Feds are using the restaurant as HQ, tying up their phones and yelling at Mickey, the robber. Louise's essay will be on her dad or Mickey. The bank hostages are hungry but they all think Jimmy Pesto pizza stinks. Bob is sent to the bank with burgers. Bob is taken as a hostage...

3.title: Synchronized Swimming
3.plot: The Belcher children sign up for an independent study of synchronized swimming in lieu on participating in gym class. Linda disturbingly watches "pregnant yoga" and comes to the rescue of her children in the end.

5.title: Food Truckin'
5.plot: Bob gives the food truck business a try.

6.title: Dr. Yap
6.plot: When a drugged Bob kisses Gayle thinking she's Linda, Gayle develops a crush on him.

7.title: Moody Foodie
7.plot: A bad review leads to drastic actions.

8.title: Bad Tina
8.plot: Tina pals around with a bad girl.

1.title: Ear-Sy Rider
1.plot: While a biker gang begins hanging out at the restaurant, Louise goes through a crisis after a teenager steals her bunny ear hat.

2.title: Full Bars
2.plot: On Halloween, the kids run into bullies when they go trick-or-treating in the rich neighborhood, while Bob and Linda attend a party where someone kills Teddy's pet guinea pig.

3.title: Bob Fires the Kids
3.plot: Fearing that he is ruining their childhoods, Bob fires the kids from their jobs at the restaurant, but they just end up working for hippies who run a marijuana farm, instead.

4.title: Mutiny on the Windbreaker
4.plot: Bob brings the family along when he is hired to be a chef on a docked cruise ship, so they can see his skills outside the restaurant.

5.title: An Indecent Thanksgiving Proposal
5.plot: In order to entice an old flame who is only attracted to married men, Mr. Fischoeder bribes Bob into letting him pass off Linda and the kids as his own family, but the situation ruins all of Bob's Thanksgiving traditions.

6.title: The Deepening
6.plot: Mr. Fischoeder buys a mechanical movie shark as an attraction for his amusement park, but the kids accidentally let it loose on the town, forcing Bob and Teddy to save the day.

7.title: Tinarannosaurus Wrecks
7.plot: Tina is wracked with guilt when Bob forces her to lie about an accident that occurred when he let her drive his car, but a shady insurance adjuster sees through their ploy and blackmails Bob into committing more insurance fraud.

8.title: The Unbearable Like-Likeness of Gene
8.plot: An incredibly annoying girl develops a crush on Gene, but he can't bring himself to dump her after he finds out her father has a music studio in their home.

9.title: Bob Rest Ye Merry Gentle-Mannequins
9.plot: 'Tis the season for strange holiday mannequins.

10.title: Mother Daughter Laser Razor
10.plot: Linda struggles to connect with Louise when they attend a mother-daughter seminar, while Bob takes Tina to get her legs waxed.

11.title: Nude Beach
11.plot: It's dingles and dongles and birthday suits.

12.title: Broadcast Wagstaff School News
12.plot: Tina is on a mission to unmask the middle school.

14.title: Lindapendent Woman
14.plot: Linda quits the restaurant and takes up a job at a grocery store.

15.title: O.T.: The Outside Toilet
15.plot: Eugene encounters a mysterious talking toilet.

16.title: Topsy
16.plot: The Belcher kids take on a Thomas Edison fanatic.

17.title: Two for Tina
17.plot: Tina finds herself in a love triangle.

18.title: It Snakes a Village
18.plot: Bob and the family take a swinging vacation.

19.title: Family Fracas
19.plot: The Belchers appear on a television game show.

21.title: Boyz 4 Now
21.plot: Louise is horrified when she develops her first crush.

22.title: Carpe Museum
22.plot: A school trip to the museum turns wild for the Belchers.

23.title: The Unnatural
23.plot: Gene loses his confidence after playing badly during a baseball game so Linda sends him to a baseball coach.

1.title: A River Runs Through Bob
1.plot: Bob and the family face the great outdoors.

2.title: Fort Night
2.plot: Tricks and treats and lunatics abound.

3.title: Seaplane!
3.plot: Linda is bored by Bob's tired attempts at Date Night and decides to sign up for flying lessons. When Bob won't join her, she becomes the target of "Upskirt Kurt", the most charming pilot in the air.

4.title: My Big Fat Greek Bob
4.plot: Bob scores a temporary gig as a cook at an "underdog" frat house and discovers that he fits right in! Hijinks ensue as Bob and the rest of the fraternity brothers find themselves in the middle of a collegiate prank war that involves the house's most famous alumnus, Dr. Yap. Meanwhile, the kids are on a mission to invade the frat house and get in on the action.

5.title: Turkey in a Can
5.plot: Determined to have a perfect Thanksgiving, Bob meticulously prepares the family turkey. But, to his horror, he finds that someone then dumps the turkey in the toilet in an act of Thanksgiving sabotage.

6.title: Purple Rain-Union
6.plot: Linda has an upcoming 25 year reunion at Cardinal Gennaro High. Debbie, chairman of the reunion, needs entertainment for the gala. Linda's old band, The Ta Tas, are not even her 3rd choice, but she asks Linda to round up the band: Angie, Patsy, Nancy, and Gayle. Linda does not want to do it: 25 years ago, Bad Hair Day rocked the talent show; and BHD still rocks the pro circuit. The kids egg on Linda until she agrees to perform. Tina plans to babysit, so the kids plan to attend. Like Louise says, who would miss the train wreck of all train wrecks? The kids fail to ...

7.title: Bob and Deliver
7.plot: To Tina's delight, Bob becomes the substitute "Home Ec" teacher at her school and ends up creating a full-scale restaurant in the classroom. However, her excitement is short-lived as Bob's position causes father/daughter friction. But when Gene and Louise go to work for Bob's "school" restaurant, Linda must fend for herself at the family's "other" restaurant (aka Bob's Burgers).

8.title: Christmas in the Car
8.plot: After spending Christmas Eve outrunning a candy cane truck with their last-minute tree, the Belchers find that Bob's friend gets caught in the kids' Santa trap.

9.title: Slumber Party
9.plot: Linda decides to invite some of Louise's classmates over for a slumber party without her knowledge. With the prospect of being forced to endure an entire night with people she hates, Louise devises a plan to get all the girls to beg to go home. With the help of Tina and Gene, she starts to try and scare them off, but one is reluctant to go.

10.title: Presto-Tina-o
10.plot: Tina becomes a magician's assistant in order to get closer to Jimmy Jr., while Bob becomes the victim of a magician's "curse."

11.title: Easy Commercial, Easy Gommercial
11.plot: To compete with fellow "restaurateur," Jimmy Pesto, and his blowout Super Bowl event, Bob is determined to create a Bob's Burgers commercial to air during the "big game." In an effort to outshine Pesto, the Belchers recruit Randy, a documentarian, to assist with the filmmaking and hire on former pro football star Connie Frye to be the celebrity endorser.

12.title: The Frond Files
12.plot: The Belcher children write fantasy essays about their school that their guidance counselor finds offensive.

13.title: Mazel Tina
13.plot: A series of mishaps leave Tina the center of attention at a classmate's Bat Mitzvah she wasn't invited to.

14.title: Uncle Teddy
14.plot: Bob and Linda ask Teddy to babysit the kids while they're on a romantic getaway at a Burger Convention. In the process, Teddy earns the title "Uncle Teddy" when he puts Tina's crush in his place for using her to get free burgers.

15.title: The Kids Rob a Train
15.plot: Bob, Linda, and the kids board a train for a wine tasting while the kids are put in the caboose. The kids sneak out in an attempt to steal the chocolate from the kitchen car while Bob challenges another person on the train to a contest.

16.title: I Get Psychic Out of You
16.plot: Linda is believed to be a psychic when she correctly predicts that a telemarketer is calling the restaurant.

17.title: The Equestranauts
17.plot: In an homage to the "Bronies" subculture, Tina attends her first Equestra-con, a convention based on her favorite animated pony show, "The Equestranauts." To her surprise, she finds that the show's fans are middle-aged men (called "Equesticles"). When a powerful super-fan tricks Tina out of her rare toy pony, it's up to Bob to go undercover to get it back.

18.title: Ambergris
18.plot: Gene, Louise, and Tina discover a seaweed-covered object at the beach that turns out to be a large hunk of Ambergris - an extremely valuable, but illegal, by-product of whale poop that is used in high-end perfumes. But Louise tries to cheat Gene and Tina out of the profit she hopes to make by selling the treasure on the black market. Meanwhile, Bob and Linda deal with their psychologically unstable landlord who is building them a new bathroom.

19.title: The Kids Run Away
19.plot: Upon learning that she has a cavity and needs a filling, Louise runs away from the dentist's office and seeks refuge at Aunt Gail's. When Louise refuses to go home, Linda sends Tina and Gene to join her and bets her that she won't last the weekend with Aunt Gail's "craziness."

20.title: Gene It On
20.plot: Tina tries out for cheerleading, but a spirited and enthusiastic spectator Gene makes more of an impression.

21.title: Wharf Horse (or How Bob Saves/Destroys the Town - Part I)
21.plot: Motivated by the promise of a new beachside burger joint, Bob conspires with Felix to convince Mr. Fischoeder to sell Wonder Wharf. Meanwhile, Tina protests the destruction of the wharf's carousel by chaining herself to it.

22.title: World Wharf II: The Wharfening (or How Bob Saves/Destroys the Town - Part II)
22.plot: It's Linda and the kids to the rescue when Felix takes desperate measures, and puts Bob and Mr. Fischoeder in danger.

1.title: Work Hard or Die Trying, Girl
1.plot: Gene tries to make one of his dreams a reality when he gets the opportunity to make a musical version of Die Hard at the Wagstaff Fall Festival.

2.title: Tina and the Real Ghost
2.plot: Tina begins an out-of-this-world romance with a ghost that is believed to be living in the Belcher's basement.

3.title: Friends with Burger-fits
3.plot: Bob becomes Teddy's workout buddy after finding out his burgers contributed to Teddy's bad health. The two enroll in a stuntman boot camp where their friendship is put to the test. Meanwhile, the kids make an ice rink in the freezer, with Linda running their underground ice wrestling league.

4.title: Dawn of the Peck
4.plot: While Bob is boycotting the holiday, Linda and the kids spend Thanksgiving at the First Annual Fischoeder Turk-tacular Turkey Town Festival. However, a wild bird attack leads to total mayhem.

5.title: Best Burger
5.plot: Bob is in a "best burger" competition, but is at risk of losing when an important part of the burger is nowhere to be found.

6.title: Father of the Bob
6.plot: At Bob's father's Christmas party, Bob and "Big Bob" rehash an old argument and try to outdo each other in the kitchen. Meanwhile, the kids compete to find the best gift for their dad.

7.title: Tina Tailor Soldier Spy
7.plot: After being pestered by the kids and a mistake by Gretchen, Linda decides to dye her hair full blonde. Meanwhile, when trying to quit the Thunder Girls Tina is asked to find a mole in the troop.

8.title: Midday Run
8.plot: Tina gets Gene and Louise to help ensure she gets a big hall-monitor promotion.

9.title: Speakeasy Rider
9.plot: Tina, Gene and Louise are ready to put the pedal to the metal when they join a go-kart league. Meanwhile, at the restaurant Bob and Teddy partner up to serve Teddy's home-brewed beer.

10.title: Late Afternoon in the Garden of Bob and Louise
10.plot: In order to become a member of the community garden, Bob must give Louise's enemy a job.

11.title: Can't Buy Me Math
11.plot: Tina and Darryl team up to win the Cupid's Couple contest; Linda plans Valentine's Day activities.

12.title: The Millie-churian Candiate
12.plot: Desperate to keep Millie from becoming class president and ruining the school, Tina and Louise volunteer to help run Jimmy Junior's campaign.

13.title: The Gayle Tales
13.plot: The kids compete to be their Aunt Gayle's companion for the evening.

14.title: L'il Hard Dad
14.plot: Bob becomes obsessed with his new automatic helicopter. When it falls apart for no reason, he enters into a battle with the manufacturer in order to receive a refund. Gene assists Bob in his quest, but things quickly get out of hand and end in a crazy helicopter battle. Meanwhile, Louise and Linda help Tina prepare for her oral book report.

15.title: Adventures in Chinchilla-sitting
15.plot: Bob and Linda head out on the town for a date - but to Linda's dismay, Bob's idea of romance proves "trivial." Meanwhile, a wild chinchilla chase ensues after the school pet that Louis was charged with watching escapes out the front door.

16.title: The Runway Club
16.plot: The kids try to escape Saturday detention so they can attend the Cotton Candy Festival.

17.title: Itty Bitty Ditty Committee
17.plot: Gene is promptly kicked out of the band he formed with Tina, Louise, Rudy, Peter, and Daryl, and proclaims he is never going to play keyboard again.

18.title: Eat, Spray, Linda
18.plot: It's Linda's birthday and Bob needs more time to plan her birthday surprise. But when he sends her out of the house as a distraction, she goes missing. Mayhem ensues as the Belchers must work together to find Linda.

19.title: Housetrap
19.plot: When a vicious storm strikes during the Belcher family's vacation at a beach house in Craggy Neck, they find themselves staying with the mysterious owner.

20.title: Hawk & Chick
20.plot: Bob and Louise are thrilled when they meet Hawk, the star of their favorite martial arts series, and are quick to offer help upon learning about his family troubles.

21.title: The Oeder Games
21.plot: With the threat of a rent increase on Ocean Avenue, Bob and the other tenants rebel. After approaching Fischoeder, the tenants find out that they will have to compete in order to convince him to keep their rents reasonable.

1.title: Sliding Bobs
1.plot: When Bob starts to lose his hair, Linda reminisces about his mustache and how it made her fall for him; the kids make up their own versions of how Bob and Linda met.

2.title: The Land Ship
2.plot: Bob thinks the upcoming Land Ship parade will increase business -- until he learns two porta-potties will be in front of his restaurant; Tina's friends tell her she is boring.

3.title: Hauntening
3.plot: When Louise admits that she has never felt scared before, the family goes to a haunted house in an effort to change but mayhem ensues after their visit.

4.title: Gayle Makin' Bob Sled
4.plot: Bob goes to pick up Gayle so she does not miss the Thanksgiving celebration, but gets caught in a snowstorm coming back, leaving Linda to prepare the turkey.

5.title: Nice-Capades
5.plot: A grumpy mall Santa threatens to put Gene, Tina and Louise on the naughty list, inspiring them to arrange a musical performance in hopes of changing Santa's mind before Christmas.

6.title: The Cook, the Steve, the Gayle, & Her Lover
6.plot: When Bob throws a dinner party, Gayle takes advantage of the opportunity to introduce her new love interest to the family; a long-standing feud is revealed.

7.title: The Gene and Courtney Show
7.plot: Gene and Courtney are given the opportunity to be the new hosts of morning announcements, but their romantic history poses challenges; Tina's plan goes awry.

8.title: Sexy Dance Healing
8.plot: Bob must take legal action after he slips on the sidewalk and needs to pay for surgery; Jairo promises to heal Bob without doctors; the kids fake a law firm.

9.title: Sacred Couch
9.plot: Louise wants the family to get a new couch, but the family votes against it. So she decides to take care of the problem herself.

10.title: Lice Things Are Lice
10.plot: When Tina volunteers alongside Nurse Liz, she finds herself involved in the biggest scandal to hit Wagstaff: a lice infestation. Meanwhile, Bob makes improvements to the restaurant that end up driving customers away. Can the Belchers juggle both a crisis at the restaurant and lice?

11.title: House of 1000 Bounces
11.plot: The Belcher kids hop into action after news of a bounce house crisis at a birthday party; Bob encounters a guest at the restaurant, fixing him to face a fear.

12.title: Stand by Gene
12.plot: When Gene overhears talk about a mystical creature that lives nearby, he leads the Belcher kids and their friends on a journey to find it. Meanwhile, Linda's competitive nature takes over during downtime at the restaurant.

13.title: Wag the Hog
13.plot: The Belchers try to help Bob's friend, Critter, after he lands in jail for unpaid parking tickets; Linda takes a job as a babysitter.

14.title: The Hormone-iums
14.plot: Tina gets her wish for Wagstaff fame, but soon regrets it. Linda pursues an improbable business venture, but struggles to get it off the ground.

15.title: Pro Tiki/Con Tiki
15.plot: Bob's friend Warren comes to visit and makes an offer to invest in the restaurant; Bob is hesitant when he finds out about Warren's interior design ideas.

16.title: Bye Bye Boo Boo
16.plot: Louise enters a contest with the hopes that Tina will get to meet Boo Boo from Boyz 4 Now; Bob learns more about the history of the restaurant.

17.title: The Horse Rider-er
17.plot: Tina manages to convince her parents to send her to horse camp; but in doing so, she realizes she must end her relationship with her imaginary horse, Jericho.

18.title: Secret Admiral-irer
18.plot: Tina's ideas of love and romance are tested when she volunteers at a nursing home to earn her next Thunder Girls badge. Meanwhile, Bob makes new friends who lead him to make some questionable choices.

19.title: Glued, Where's My Bob?
19.plot: The Belcher children are involved in a goop war prank that takes place on the same day that a journalist is visiting the restaurant to write a profile.

1.title: Flu-ouise
1.plot: Louise comes down with the flu and falls into a wild fever dream filled with familiar faces, zany musical numbers and a crazy adventure.

2.title: Sea Me Now
2.plot: Teddy tries to impress his ex-wife by organizing a day trip on his newly refurbished boat; Tina attempts to prove she's responsible enough to have a cellphone by taking care Bob's prized eraser.

3.title: Teen-a-Witch
3.plot: When Tammy steals her idea for winning the annual Halloween costume contest, Tina turns to witchcraft.

4.title: They Serve Horses, Don't They?
4.plot: The Belchers find themselves involved in a full-blown investigation when Bob secures a new meat provider who claims to save money on every order.

5.title: Larger Brother, Where Fart Thou?
5.plot: Gene and Louise are left home alone when Tina ends up in detention, while Bob and Linda get into trouble with their accountant.

6.title: The Quirk-ducers
6.plot: The Belcher kids produce their own version of the annual Thanksgiving play and Linda finds a potato that resembles her late grandfather.

7.title: The Last Gingerbread House on the Left
7.plot: Bob gets involved in a gingerbread house competition with Mr. Fischoeder and his friends while Linda, Teddy and the kids spread Christmas cheer through caroling.

8.title: Ex Mach Tina
8.plot: After hurting her ankle, Tina enrolls in a program that enables her send a robot of herself to school and the robot gives her an unexpected breakthrough with Jimmy Jr.

9.title: Bob Actually
9.plot: With Valentine's Day around the corner, the kids find themselves in love-caused chaos and Bob comes up with a romantic gesture to impress Linda.

10.title: There's No Business Like Mr. Business Business
10.plot: Bob is skeptical about Gayle's cat Mr. Business having a career in showbiz, until it looks like the cat could have his big break.

11.title: A Few 'Gurt Men
11.plot: Louise finds herself in a predicament when she is told that she will be representing one of her biggest enemies at Wagstaff during a mock-trial.

12.title: Like Gene for Chocolate
12.plot: Gene learns that the formula for his favorite chocolate has changed, so he works with the head of the company to fix the problem. In the meantime, Bob gets wrapped up in one of Teddy's not-so-perfect plans.

13.title: The Grand Mama-Pest Hotel
13.plot: Linda chaperones Tina's weekend at a heroine convention, while Gene and Louise spend the weekend with Bob.

14.title: Aquaticism
14.plot: The Belcher kids hatch a plan to save the aquarium from closure, while Bob learns a few things about Linda's customer service skills.

15.title: Ain't Miss Debatin'
15.plot: Tina is recruited for the debate team, while Gene and Louise make a stop motion film centered on a surprising subject matter.

16.title: Eggs for Days
16.plot: At the annual Easter egg hunt, Bob and Linda have a little too much fun hiding the eggs, so the Belchers race to find the one egg rotting in its hiding place.

17.title: Zero Larp Thirty
17.plot: Linda wins a contest to spend a weekend at the home where her favorite TV show is filmed, but it doesn't quite go as planned.

18.title: The Laser-inth
18.plot: Bob and Gene go to the last-ever rock-and-roll laser show at the planetarium while Linda and the girls go out to dinner at a wacky restaurant.

19.title: Thelma & Louise Except Thelma Is Linda
19.plot: Linda could lose her position as the leader of the Wagstaff bake sale when Louise gets in trouble at school.

20.title: Mom, Lies and Videotapes
20.plot: Linda catches a cold just before the Mother's Day show at Wagstaff.

21.title: Paraders of the Lost Float
21.plot: Teddy talks Bob into entering the Bog to Beach parade even though the forecast calls for rain.

22.title: Into the Mild
22.plot: Bob realizes his dream of being an outdoorsman when the wilderness equipment store has a going out of business sale; Linda and the kids spend the night watching Aunt Gayle rehearse for her one-woman show.

1.title: Brunchsquatch
1.plot: Bob decides to serve brunch to compete with Jimmy Pesto; the Belcher kids help Mr. Fischoeder's brother hide from him.

2.title: The Silence of the Louise
2.plot: Louise enlists Millie's help to find the culprit who attacked Mr. Frond's therapy dolls.

3.title: The Wolf of Wharf Street
3.plot: On Halloween night, Linda tries to impress the kids by taking them to look for a wolf that has been terrorizing the town. Meanwhile, an injured and medicated Bob believes that Teddy has turned into a werewolf.

4.title: Sit Me Baby One More Time
4.plot: Tina starts a babysitting franchise that goes off the rails when Tammy is hired to work with her.

5.title: Thanks-hoarding
5.plot: The Belchers discover that Teddy is a secret hoarder when they reluctantly agree to pitch in for Thanksgiving with his family.

6.title: The Bleakening - Part One & Two
6.plot: Linda wants to add some extra cheer to the holidays by throwing a holiday party.

8.title: V for Valentine-detta
8.plot: Tina has a rough break up on Valentine's Day, so Linda and Louise take her on a girls' night out, while Bob and Gene have a trapeze experience that brings them closer.

9.title: Y Tu Ga-Ga Tambien
9.plot: Gene disapproves of a new playground game; Linda fills in for the local library storyteller.

10.title: The Secret Ceramics Room of Secrets
10.plot: The kids are tasked with giving their grandma homemade gifts for her birthday and set out to find a secret ceramics room that, according to urban legend, has been boarded up for years.

11.title: Sleeping with the Frenemy
11.plot: Tina allows Tammy to stay with the Belchers during Spring Break and fixes her up with a boy from out of town.

12.title: The Hurt Soccer
12.plot: The Belchers sign Louise up for a soccer league and must help her train for the last game of the season.

13.title: Cheer Up Sleepy Gene
13.plot: Gene is nervous about going to his first sleepover and realizes he had a right to be when things don't go as planned.

14.title: The Trouble with Doubles
14.plot: Bob and Linda get trapped in an Escape Room while on a double date with another couple. Meanwhile, Louise hosts a zombie-movie night, but Tina takes charge when the zombies prove to be too scary.

15.title: Go Tina on the Mountain
15.plot: Tina befriends a hermit living in the woods when she, Gene and Louise go to Outdoor Education; Bob and Linda see what it's like to be empty-nesters.

16.title: Are You There Bob? It's Me, Birthday
16.plot: Linda and the kids try to put together a last-minute surprise party when they forget Bob's birthday, but to do so, Linda asks Hugo to take Bob with him on his restaurant health inspections.

17.title: Boywatch
17.plot: Tina joins the Junior Lifeguards, but she struggles with the training, prompting one of her fellow junior guards to try and make her quit.

18.title: As I Walk Through the Alley of the Shadow of Ramps
18.plot: Louise gets into a turf war with a juice truck owner trying to set up shop in the Belcher's alley; Linda realizes she can't always come to her sister's defense.

19.title: Mo Mommy Mo Problems
19.plot: On Mother's Day, the Belchers wind up in a real estate scheme when attend open houses for free food and Linda meets a charming real estate agent.

20.title: Mission Impos-Slug-Ble
20.plot: Louise devises a plan to get her extensive Burobu card collection back after it's confiscated at school.

21.title: Something Old, Something New, Something Bob Caters for You
21.plot: The Belchers cater a wedding for a couple who fell in love at the restaurant.

1.title: Episode #10.1
1.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Bob's Burgers centers on the Belcher family (consists of Bob, Linda, Tina, Gene and Louise) who own a hamburger restaurant. Bob's burgers are really delicious and appear to be better than his rivals' but when it comes to selling burgers, his kids aren't really helpful, as more customers head over to Jimmy Pesto's restaurant.
imdb.title: Bob's Burgers
plot: Bob Belcher, along with his wife and 3 children, try to run their last hope of holding the family together, which is running Bob's dream restaurant.

_Bob's Burgers_ (qv) centers on the Belcher family (consists of Bob, Linda, Tina, Gene and Louise) who own a hamburger restaurant. Bob's burgers are really delicious and appear to be better than his rivals' but when it comes to selling burgers, his kids aren't really helpful, as more customers head over to Jimmy Pesto's restaurant.::Campbell Talaepa

Bob Belcher and wife, Linda, love one other and their kids: Tina, Gene and Louise. Together, they run _Bob's Burgers_ (qv) where the food is great but life always gets in the way of business.::LA-Lawyer

Bob Belcher, a father with bad luck, runs his Burger restaurant with his three mischievous children and his wife, Linda. Gene, the only son, is eleven and will do anything for anything to nothing. Tina, the eldest, who is 13, is lost looking for a love that always seems to come to Jimmy Pesto Jr, the son of Bobs competition restaurant owner. And the youngest child, Louise, is a crazy, power-loving, somewhat-creepy little 9 year-old girl. Linda is a singer, and always has a glass of wine in her hand. Even with the crazy events going on, Bob and his family always pull through and it always has hilarious results.::infinity95
